fields.headline: In brief
fields.bodyText: Thornton's fires finance chief The chocolate-maker Thornton's has sacked its finance director and started a search for a successor who has better IT skills. Martin Allen, who had been with the company for six years, will get about £150,000 as a golden goodbye. Thornton's chairman, Chris Burnett, said: "We have been investing heavily in systems but we are not getting the benefits that we should. Martin's skills were not in that area, so we have decided to part company." Bournemouth lands Thomson The low-fare airline run by holiday company Thomson is to operate from Bourne mouth airport from next year. Thomsonfly.com will fly from Bournemouth in March to a range of destinations in mainland Europe. The move, which will help create more than 60 jobs, is in addition to Thomsonfly's base at Coventry airport. Game plan for colliery Sports goods company Sports World International is planning to create more than 1,000 jobs with the construction of a distribution centre on the site of the former Shirebrook colliery in Derbyshire. The 62-acre site has been reclaimed under English Partnerships' national coalfields programme. Fears for jobs at drugs HQ French drug maker Sanofi-Aventis is to close the former UK headquarters of Aventis and consolidate operations at its offices in Guildford, Surrey. The move leaves uncertain the future of some 240 jobs at the Aventis site in West Malling, Kent.
